rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Land use in the Scotland district, Barbados.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: To discuss land use is to discuss a matter of major geographic interest, and to outline methods of recording and explaining land use is to outline practically the whole range of a geographer's methods and techniques of regional analysis and synthesis. Even though there is a considerable diversity in the scope of land use studies, many are but regional studies emphasizing agriculture (e.g. C. C. Zimmerman, 1937). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geography.
Land capabilty for agriculture -- Barbados.
Land use -- Barbados

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Classification of centres in the Montreal environs and Eastern townships regions.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis is presented as a tentative attempt to classify the cities, towns and villages of the Montreal Environs and Eastern Townships Regions and in the light of regional planning principles to verify the adequacy of the resulting regional systems. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geography.
City planning -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.
Suburbs -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Ice cover and surface heat fluxes in Baffin Bay.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Latent and sensible heat fluxes at the surface of Baffin Bay are calculated throughout the year using, in addition to the essential meteorological data and surface temperatures, values of the ice cover corresponding to three different periods of years, ranging from 1919 to 1965. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Earth temperature -- Northwest Territories -- Baffin Bay.
Meteorology.
Ice -- Baffin Bay.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Pulsed photoconductivity in cadmium sulphide.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The measurement of the electron mobility in Cadmium Sulphide was attempted using a transit-time method in which the carrier transit time is determined from the waveshape of the transient current associated with the drift of electrons photo-generated at one electrode by a short pulse of strongly absorbed light. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An experimental study in near field sound diffraction.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The problem of reliable near-field measurements with the basic free-space method in the illuminated region between a source of sound waves and a scattering obstacle is studied. In order to delineate the probe effects and estimate their significance, a brief yet comprehensive outline of probe behaviour is given initially. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The water budget of the Knob Lake area : a hydrologic study in central Labrador-Ungava.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The discipline of hydrology encompasses all studies of the occurrence, origins, properties, and distribution of the earth's waters. It is a branch of physical geography, but forms indistinct boundaries with other earth sciences. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geography.
Hydrology -- Québec (Province) -- Knob Lake Area.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The vibration of multi-girder highway bridges.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Previous investigations have shown that treating a bridge as a single simple beam is inadequate in the analysis of most multi-girder highway bridges. The transverse distribution of deflection must be considered as well as the longitudinal distribution. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Simultaneous and delayed matching-to sample in children
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Matching-to-sample usually involves the presentation of a stimulus, the sample, and several other stimuli, the matches, with the requirement that the subject find a stimulus in the latter array which matches the sample. ln visual matching-to-sample tasks the stimuli are often presented by means of a slide projector or card-changing apparatus, thus permitting the experimenter to control the duration and sequence of exposure. The subject indicates his choice by pointing to the matching stimulus, by pressing a pushbutton under the stimulus, or by pushing the stimulus directly to close a switch. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology -- Mental tests

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Pentlandite phase relations in the Fe-Ni-S system and the stability of the pyrite-pentlandite assemblage.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In the last decade geologists have made increasing use of phase equilibrium studies in synthetic systems to provide the fundamental data for the interpretation and understanding of the occurrence of minerals and mineral assemblages. The economic geologist has directed considerable study into the phase relations of the Fe-Ni-S system as a large number of the phases are found as minerals, which in some cases constitute important sources of nickel, iron and related metals. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Use of morphological properties of soils to establish land capability ratings.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Whether a particular soil should be used for cropping, pasture, woodland or some other purpose, involves consequences which are far too important to be left to chance. Soil is a natural body having a specific morphology and in order to understand its behaviour as fully as possible, it is necessary to determine and to correlate its characteristics or properties under various sets of circumstances. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Soil Science.
Soils -- Classification

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The Macdonald dual progress plan : a study in curriculum development and school organization.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: For the past 100 years the majority of schools in North America have been organized on a graded basis. The classification of children by grades, the common method in Quebec, assumes that if a child is ten years old and in grade five then he should be able to work at the same level as his peers in all the subjects of the curriculum. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Elementary school administration
Education.
Education, Elementary -- Curricula.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Le réalisme dans les romans des fréres Goncourt.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of French Language and Literature
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Entre 1860 et 1869, Edmond et Jules de Goncourt publient six romans : Charles Demailly (1860), Soeur Philomène (1861), Renée Mauperin (1864), Germinie Lacerteux (1865), Manette Salomon (1867), Madame Gervaisais (1869). C'est la totalité de la production romanesque des deux frères.Ces volumes forment un ensemble bien groupé dans le temps, où se retrouve une évidente unité d'intention, de ton, d'écriture. Les historiens de la littérature sont aujourd'hui d'accord pour classer ces oeuvres sous la rubrique "Romans réalistes". Mais ils diffèrent dans leur analyse et leur appréciation du "réalisme" de ces ouvrages. A quoi tient réellement ce "réalisme" ? Telle est, présentée de la façon la plus sommaire, la question à quoi le présent mémoire se propose de répondre. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Goncourt, Edmond de, 1822-1896 -- Criticism and interpretation.
Realism in literature.
Literature, Romance.
Goncourt, Jules de, 1830-1870 -- Criticism and interpretation.
